intro: Lessingia germanorum subsp. eu-germanorum, commonly known as the European Lessingia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many well-known flowering plants. The species is characterized by its small, white or pale purple flowers and linear, grass-like leaves. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. This subspecies is distinguished by its slightly more robust growth compared to other members of the species.
